item.description: You'll need the awesome remotedebug-ios-webkit-adapter. Follow the install instructions. Requires scoop.
item.content:encoded:
Setting up to remotely debug your IOS(phone/tablet) from Windows

You'll need the awesome remotedebug-ios-webkit-adapter. Follow the install instructions. Requires scoop.

Then when you get to the debugging using the Chrome dev tools, make sure you add the localhost:9000 to the network targets list.

Also note that both Itunes and the phone seem to keep requesting confirmation that the link is trusted.

item.title: Minimal ASP.Net Core MVC setup
item.description: Sometimes I want a very minimal setup, when trying out new things. Below will creates such a project (Built with ASP.Net Core 2.1).
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes I want a very minimal setup, when trying out new things. Below will creates such a project (Built with ASP.Net Core 2.1).

Source Repo

Steps

  1. Create a new Empty ASP.NET Core Web Application

Install MVC nuget package

  1. Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc Note: make sure the version major.minor match the project version. In this case
project --> 2.1
nuget package --> 2.1.3

Modify Startup.cs

  1. add services.AddMvc(); to ConfigureServices
  2. optionally add this to Configure 
    else
{
    app.UseExceptionHandler("/Home/Error");
    app.UseHsts();
}

app.UseHttpsRedirection();
app.UseStaticFiles();
app.UseCookiePolicy();
  3. Replace 
    app.Run(async (context) =>
{
 await context.Response.WriteAsync("Hello World!");
});

with the following.

	app.UseMvc(routes =>
	{
    	routes.MapRoute(
    	    name: "default",
    	    template: "{controller=Home}/{action=Index}/{id?}");
	});

Add Controllers

  1. Create new folder Controllers
  2. Create a new HomeController

Add View

  1. Click on Add View... on the controller action. Uncheck the Use layout page.

Run and verify

item.title: Tuple Deconstruction
item.content:encoded:
Added in C# 7

Deconstruction (Tuples)

Basic syntax

var (name, address, city, zip) = contact.GetAddress();

it's possible to ignore fields by using the _ placeholder.

var (_, _, _, pop1, _, pop2) = QueryCityDataForYears("New York City", 1960, 2010);

Currently supported usages

  • Declaration: var (x, y) = e;
  • Assignment: (x, y) = e; where x and y have already been declared
  • foreach foreach(var(x, y) in e)

Deconstructing user defined types

Need to add one or more Deconstruct methods.

public void Deconstruct(out string firstname, out string lastname, out string middleinitial)
